channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Maley Avenue SE27 opposite side of the road to h, 8th February
item.description:
Maley Avenue SE27 opposite side of the road to house number 1 is a yellow plastic grit bin tagged (next to Avenue Park Rd junction) which is graffiti tagged. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor for reporting pin &, picture.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maley Avenue, Tulse Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge potholes, 8th February
item.description:
There are really deep potholes near the turning with St Julian's Farm Road. It's a major bus route and a single lane and all traffic have to drive around the holes to avoid them. The fabric of the road is awful

item.title: Norwood Road number 387 up alley between 385 & 389, 8th February
item.description:
Norwood Road between 385 and 389 there is an alley the leads to Station Rise. Down said alley is 387 Norwood Road SE27 9BQ (Buondi Caffe) which on left end of frontage black metal cigarette butt wall bin is graffiti tagged. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor for reporting pin &, picture.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 379, Norwood Road, Tulse Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Norwood Road SE27 between 385 and 389 there is an, 8th February
item.description:
Norwood Road SE27 between 385 and 389 there is an alley the leads to Station Rise. Re number 8 Station Rise flats face on to said alley and one of two windows have been graffiti tagged. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor for picture and Google Streetview looking from Norwood Road end of alley: https://www.google.com/maps/@51.4392822,-0.1060749,3a,75y,72.44h,83.81t/data=!3m7!1e1!3m5!1snMiekxW4fkfqFGK2F9FRnw!2e0!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D6.18968806962954%26panoid%3DnMiekxW4fkfqFGK2F9FRnw%26yaw%3D72.44194463068641!7i16384!8i8192?authuser=0&entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI2MDIwNC4wIKXMDSoKLDEwMDc5MjA2N0gBUAM%3D

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Station Rise, Tulse Hill, Greater London

item.title: Nonstop flytipping on corner of road, 8th February
item.description:
There is daily flytipping at the corner of mackenzie road from the flats neighbouring el molina. Nothing is happening about this despite the landlord being granted planning to convert the neighbouring shop with the condition they address the inadequate bin situation
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mackenzie Road, Penge, Greater London

item.description:

item.title: Bin liners dumped, 8th February
item.description:
Again four large bin liners have been dumped on the pavement outside my home. It’s every two weeks at the moment. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alleyn Road, Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked storm drain, 8th February
item.description:
This drain is located in Stapley road outside number 15. It always floods when there is rain and cannot cope at all with heavy rainfall. It is no longer fit for purpose, with water just passing over it. It has been like this for several months but, recently it seems to be very clogged with an oily, sticky black substance. This needs to be unblocked, so that it works as intended, to drain water away.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Stapley Road, Upper Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flank wall of No 1 Sandy Road, 8th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Sandy Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The road and pavements covered in dog foul., 8th February
item.description:
I visit my nan on a weekly basis, as she can’t get out much. One neighbour blocks the road with there bins so I can’t park near to my nans house and has been doing this for over a year now. Also when I visit not only do I end up driving in dog foul while pulling into a parking space the amount on the pavements is absolutely disgusting. Today there were 3 lots in the road, one in which I drove over and I counted 5 lots of mess walking 3 houses down to my nans house.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Marmadon Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose flag stone, 8th February
item.description:
Outside 79 Raeburn Road am where the drive / dropped kerb meets the road, one of the long flag stones has dislodged and moves like a see-saw if driven over. This in turn forces a jet of water up into the air and is becoming more loose and is likely to flick up and hit the underside of any vehicle travelling over it. Also a trip hazard.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 81, Raeburn Road, Falconwood, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crash damaged / stolen and dumped 69 plate BMW 3 series blue, 8th February
item.description:
Suspected stolen car, crashed and dumped after being used by joyriders in hobblingwell rec carpark. Car was seen doing donuts then crashed into curb smashing off rear wheel. Passenger footwell full of laughing gas canisters
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leesons Way, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
